line.en: An-chan got one of his contacts to repair the\nbroken winch.
It's an old model, and there was rattling with\nsome other parts, so he said the repairs will\ntake at least a week.
We were so busy until yesterday. Now, suddenly,\nwe have nothing to do.
We're all...
...completely devastated.
It's not like there's nothing for us to do.
I head back to the simulator before I forget the\nfeeling of flying, and as always, Amane goes back\nto the drawing board.
Kotori opened a book she borrowed from the\nlibrary to check something.
'I'm back! I bought the ice cream too!'
Ageha, who had lost our game of\nrock-paper-scissors, had come back from buying\nice cream.
She gives out the ice cream to everyone.
'Whatcha reading Kotori?'
'...Oh, nothing much. I'm finding out about\nMorning Glory.'
'...Our final objective is not just to fly, is\nit?'
At some point the test flight had become our\nobjective, but that was really just a milestone.
To go above the clouds was our true objective. We\nalso need to do that this summer.
After she finished giving out the ice cream, she\ndug into her own, and slumped down in the chair.
'The truth is, until now all we've done is a load\nof test flights...'
'There's nothing we can do about it right now. We\ncan't fly without the winch.'
I feel that the simulator isn't really enough.
'Why don't you do your homework or something\nwhile you have the chance?'
'I've done it already.'
'Wow, that was quick...'
When did she have enough spare time to do that?
'None of us have done any summer-type stuff at\nall, have we?'
'All the summer festivals finished before we even\nrealized.'
That's because we've been in the garage the whole\ntime. If I had to say, the only kind of summer\nactivity we did was eating that watermelon.
'I want to do summer things! Hey, do you wanna go\nswimming somewhere?'
'Where can we go? Everyone's gonna be at the pool\nand the beach, so they'll all be jam-packed.'
'At the school pool... the Swimming Club is\npracticing like crazy.'
She must have seen that on the way back from the\nstore and felt that she wanted to do it too.
'...Hmm? Ah! That's it! There is somewhere we can\nswim!'
'Oh... You mean that place?'
As soon as she said that, I knew where she meant.
'Let's go swim! Right now!'
Standing up quickly, she turns round to look at\nAmane and Kotori.
'...No way, I can't...'
'Why not?'
'...I only have a school swimsuit.'
'I don't even have that. When was the last time I\nhad a lesson in the pool?'
'In that case, why don't we go buy something?'
And that's why, being pushed into it by Ageha, it\nwas hurriedly decided that we would be going\nswimming this afternoon.
Well, there's nothing wrong with that, I guess.
It is the summer holiday, after all. We're not so\nlazy that we'd willingly let it go to waste.
In the afternoon, we stopped off at the\ndormitory. This place is closer to where we want\nto go.
'OK guys, have you got everything? Alright, let's\ngo!'
Feeling like I was leading the outing, I took\neveryone with me as we left the dormitory.
Our destination was...
'Wow... I didn't know such a place existed!'
'Even the locals don't know about it, because\nit's off the beaten path!'
This was no beach resort... it was the shore of a\nlake.

There was sand beneath our feet, the water was
nice, we could swim there, and like Ageha said,
being off the beaten path meant that most people
didn't know about it.
It's surrounded by forest and cliffs, so it can't\nbe seen from the surrounding area.
'This is an interesting place.'
'Quack quack!'
Seeing the water, Hat flaps his wings happily.
'When we were kids, we were exploring this area\nand we discovered it.'
This was our secret place where we'd come to\nplay.
'Let's get changed and go swimming!'
Looking at the water made her get excited, just\nlike Hat.
'If we go to that cave-type thing over there, no\none in the area will be able to see us.'
Said Ageha as she pushed Kotori's wheelchair\nalong.
Because of the sand, if she didn't do that,\nKotori wouldn't be able to go forwards.
'Aoi, you can't come over here!'
'OK, I get it. You've always got such a big\nmouth...'
'Quack, quack!'
'You're a boy too, so wait over there!'
She yelled as she threw Hat back to where he was\nbefore.
'Well then, I'll get changed too.'
When I say get changed, all I mean is that I'm\ntaking my clothes off. I'm already wearing my\nswimming shorts.
'Quaaack, quaaack!'
Hat looks like he really wants to go swimming.
I thought that once in a while, he'd like to swim\nin a big, wide open place like this, so I brought\nhim along, and it seems like he's enjoying it.
'Just hold on a bit longer. Everyone will be back\nsoon.'
'Quack...'
I waited with Hat for a while, then the girls\ncame back from the shadows of the hollow.
Wearing the new swimsuits that they had just\nbought.
'Ta-da!'
'I haven't been swimming in ages!'
Urk...
'...You really are... girls after all.'
'Hold it! What's that supposed to mean!?'
'What a mean thing to say!'
'Yeah, that's right!'
'OK, I'm sorry... Usually, you don't really seem\nall that feminine, that's all.'
I continue to make these kind of terrible\ncomments, but I can't help it if it's true.
I spent basically all day, every day with them,\nso I didn't really make the distinction between\nboys and girls.
But...
'We seem feminine now, though don't we?'
They really do seem a lot more feminine. Or\nrather, I'm being made to notice.
I usually don't notice but this just reminded me\nof just how cute they are.
So this must be why all the boys in the class\nenvy me...
'Now, finally, it's the long-awaited question\ntime!'
'No, wait... that's...'
'Whose swimsuit do you like the most?'
Ageha surprised me with a really direct question!
'Hee hee!'
All of then are aware of where I'm looking and\nseem to be making poses.
